author: .paulharris
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4045 on reflection i do think that this PR will end up meaning we have older clients that can no longer read config properly because we've renamed a global constant they need. 
Not sure how many clients this affects directly (eg. vouch, but also CL's), i think we'd probably default the values as long as teku isn't too old. <@592004585506340885> <@449019668296892420> 
eg. if an older node expecting `GOSSIP_MAX_SIZE` connects to a newer BN and gets the config as `MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE`, it'd need something sensible to fall back on. And the reverse if a newer BN gets config from an older one (can be done via `config/spec` endpoint for example)
We've had similar issues raised from <@144468805697929216> where teku stopped providing a specific value that it needed due to a regression, but this is a spec based thing now.
